content.raw: Infrared motion tracking, frankly, is bad for this application. The occlusion of markers is a huge problem for tracking the wrist, especially when the wrist is pronated/supinated. This problem is exacerbated when we must also accommodate for left-handed users (if/when this functionality is added), where it would be 100% necessary to change the marker positions on the head as well as move the camera to the left side of the user to capture the wrist. Magnetic motion tracking, for one, eliminates these problems.
